001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005import java.util.List;
006import java.util.stream.IntStream;
007
008/**
009 * Utilities for sparse matrix operations and spectral decomposition.
010 *
011 * <p>
012 * This class provides a lightweight sparse matrix representation in coordinate
013 * (row, column, value) form, a builder to construct such matrices and a power
014 * iteration routine to estimate the dominant eigenvalue and eigenvector. The
015 * routines operate with concurrent double vectors implemented by
016 * {@link AtomicDoubleArray} and may be used where atomic updates to vector
017 * entries are required.
018 * </p>
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * Downstream uses: see {@link io.github.ai4ci.util.AtomicDoubleArray} and
022 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.util.AtomicDouble} for the concurrent vector types
023 * used by the matrix operations.
024 * </p>
025 *
026 * @author Rob Challen
027 */
028public class SparseDecomposition {
029
030        /**
031         * Sparse matrix in coordinate (COO) form.
032         *
033         * <p>
034         * The matrix is represented by parallel arrays of row indices, column
035         * indices and values. The storage is compact for sparse matrices and
036         * convenient for parallel iteration over non-zero entries.
037         * </p>
038         *
039         * <p>
040         * Downstream use: multiplication results are accumulated into an
041         * {@link AtomicDoubleArray} by {@link #multiply(AtomicDoubleArray)}.
042         * </p>
043         *
044         * @author Rob Challen
045         */
046        public static class SparseMatrix {
047                /**
048                 * Create a new builder for constructing a sparse matrix.
049                 *
050                 * @return a {@link SparseMatrixBuilder}
051                 */
052                public static SparseMatrixBuilder builder() {
053                        return new SparseMatrixBuilder();
054                }
055
056                final int dim;
057                final int[] rowIndices; // row indices
058                final int[] colIndices; // column indices
059                final double[] values; // matrix values
060
061                /**
062                 * Construct a sparse matrix with explicit dimension.
063                 *
064                 * @param dim        matrix dimension (number of rows/columns)
065                 * @param rowIndices array of row indices
066                 * @param colIndices array of column indices
067                 * @param values     array of values
068                 */
069                public SparseMatrix(
070                                int dim, int[] rowIndices, int[] colIndices, double[] values
071                ) {
072                        if (rowIndices.length != colIndices.length
073                                        || rowIndices.length != values.length) {
074                                throw new RuntimeException("Mismatched sizes");
075                        }
076                        this.rowIndices = rowIndices;
077                        this.colIndices = colIndices;
078                        this.values = values;
079                        this.dim = dim;
080                }
081
082                /**
083                 * Construct a sparse matrix using the supplied coordinate arrays. The
084                 * matrix dimension is inferred from the maximum index in the supplied
085                 * arrays.
086                 *
087                 * @param rowIndices array of row indices for each non-zero entry
088                 * @param colIndices array of column indices for each non-zero entry
089                 * @param values     array of values for each non-zero entry
090                 */
091                public SparseMatrix(int[] rowIndices, int[] colIndices, double[] values) {
092                        this(
093                                        Math.max(
094                                                        Arrays.stream(rowIndices).max().orElse(0),
095                                                        Arrays.stream(colIndices).max().orElse(0)
096                                        ) + 1, rowIndices, colIndices, values
097                        );
098                }
099
100                /**
101                 * Multiply this sparse matrix by the vector {@code x} and return the
102                 * result as a new {@link AtomicDoubleArray}.
103                 *
104                 * <p>
105                 * The multiplication iterates over non-zero entries in parallel. Each
106                 * contribution is accumulated into the output vector using atomic
107                 * addition so the operation is thread safe.
108                 * </p>
109                 *
110                 * @param x the input vector (must have length equal to matrix dimension)
111                 * @return the product vector as an {@link AtomicDoubleArray}
112                 */
113                public AtomicDoubleArray multiply(AtomicDoubleArray x) {
114                        if (x.length() != this.dim) {
115                                throw new RuntimeException("Mismatched shapes");
116                        }
117                        var out = new AtomicDoubleArray(x.length());
118                        IntStream.range(0, this.values.length).parallel().forEach(k -> {
119                                var j = this.colIndices[k];
120                                // multiplies across columns
121                                var Axi = x.get(j) * this.values[k];
122                                var i = this.rowIndices[k];
123                                // sums accross rows
124                                out.getAndAdd(i, Axi);
125                        });
126                        return out;
127                }
128        }
129
130        /**
131         * Builder for {@link SparseMatrix} using explicit insertion of entries.
132         *
133         * <p>
134         * The builder accumulates entries and produces a compact
135         * {@link SparseMatrix} instance when {@link #build()} is called.
136         * </p>
137         *
138         * @author Rob Challen
139         */
140        public static class SparseMatrixBuilder {
141                int dim = -1;
142                List<Integer> rowIndices = new ArrayList<>(); // rowPtr[i] to
143                                                                                                                                                // rowPtr[i+1] gives
144                                                                                                                                                // col indices and
145                                                                                                                                                // values for row i
146                List<Integer> colIndices = new ArrayList<>(); // column indices
147                List<Double> values = new ArrayList<>();
148
149                /**
150                 * Build a {@link SparseMatrix} from the entries accumulated in this
151                 * builder.
152                 *
153                 * @return a new {@link SparseMatrix}
154                 */
155                public SparseMatrix build() {
156                        return new SparseMatrix(
157                                        this.dim + 1,
158                                        this.rowIndices.stream().mapToInt(i -> i).toArray(),
159                                        this.colIndices.stream().mapToInt(i -> i).toArray(),
160                                        this.values.stream().mapToDouble(i -> i).toArray()
161                        );
162                }
163
164                /**
165                 * Insert a single non-zero entry into the matrix. Values with magnitude
166                 * below 1e-8 are ignored as numerical noise.
167                 *
168                 * @param row    row index
169                 * @param column column index
170                 * @param value  the value to insert
171                 */
172                public void insert(Integer row, Integer column, Double value) {
173                        if (value < 1e-8) { return; }
174                        if (this.dim < row) { this.dim = row; }
175                        if (this.dim < column) { this.dim = column; }
176                        this.rowIndices.add(row);
177                        this.colIndices.add(column);
178                        this.values.add(value);
179                }
180
181                /**
182                 * Insert a value into the matrix symmetrically (row,col) and (col,row).
183                 *
184                 * @param row    row index
185                 * @param column column index
186                 * @param value  value to insert
187                 */
188                public void insertSymmetric(Integer row, Integer column, Double value) {
189                        this.insert(row, column, value);
190                        this.insert(column, row, value);
191                }
192        }
193
194        // Compute Euclidean norm of a vector
195        private static double norm2(AtomicDoubleArray v) {
196                return Math.sqrt(
197                                IntStream.range(0, v.length()).parallel()
198                                                .mapToDouble(i -> v.get(i) * v.get(i)).sum()
199                );
200        }
201
202        // Normalize vector in-place
203        private static void normalize(AtomicDoubleArray v) {
204                var n = norm2(v);
205                if (n > 0) {
206                        final var invNorm = 1.0 / n;
207                        IntStream.range(0, v.length()).parallel().forEach(i -> {
208                                v.getAndApply(i, invNorm, (old, x) -> old * x);
209                        });
210                }
211        }
212
213        /**
214         * Perform power iteration to estimate the largest eigenvalue and
215         * eigenvector.
216         *
217         * <p>
218         * The routine initialises a small random vector, repeatedly applies the
219         * matrix and normalises the result using the Euclidean norm until the
220         * Rayleigh quotient converges to within {@code tol}. The returned array
221         * contains the estimated eigenvalue as the first element followed by the
222         * eigenvector components.
223         * </p>
224         *
225         * <p>
226         * Internally this method uses
227         * {@link SparseMatrix#multiply(AtomicDoubleArray)} and
228         * {@link #normalize(AtomicDoubleArray)}. The eigenvector is returned with a
229         * consistent sign to reduce variability of output.
230         * </p>
231         *
232         * @param A       the sparse matrix in triple format
233         * @param maxIter maximum number of iterations
234         * @param tol     convergence tolerance
235         * @return an array containing [lambda_max, v0, v1, ...]
236         */
237        public static double[] powerIteration(
238                        SparseMatrix A, int maxIter, double tol
239        ) {
240                var n = A.dim;
241
242                // Initialize random guess vector
243                var v = new AtomicDoubleArray(n);
244                for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) {
245                        v.set(i, Math.random() - 0.5); // Small random initial vector
246                }
247                normalize(v);
248
249                var lambdaOld = 0.0;
250
251                var converged = false;
252                for (var iter = 0; iter < maxIter; iter++) {
253                        var Av = A.multiply(v); // Av = A * v
254                        var v2 = v;
255
256                        // New eigenvalue estimate via Rayleigh quotient
257                        var lambda = IntStream.range(0, n).parallel()
258                                        .mapToDouble(i -> v2.get(i) * Av.get(i)).sum();
259
260                        // Update eigenvector approximation
261                        v = Av;
262                        normalize(v);
263
264                        // Check convergence
265                        if (Math.abs(lambda - lambdaOld) < tol) {
266                                lambdaOld = lambda;
267                                converged = true;
268                                break;
269                        }
270
271                        lambdaOld = lambda;
272                }
273                if (!converged) {
274                        throw new RuntimeException(
275                                        "Eigenvalue decomposition did not converge."
276                        );
277                }
278
279                // normalise signs otherwise we get variable output
280                if (v.get(0) < 0) {
281                        for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) {
282                                v.getAndApply(i, -1, (x, y) -> x * y);
283                        }
284                }
285
286                // Return [lambda, v0, v1, ..., vn-1]
287                var result = new double[n + 1];
288                result[0] = lambdaOld;
289                for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) {
290                        result[i + 1] = v.get(i);
291                }
292                return result;
293        }
294
295}
296
